channel.title: Help with making a tv screen a monitor
channel.description: does anybody know if this is possible? ^^^

item.title: Help with making a tv screen a monitor
item.dc:creator: @Man_UTD_Freak Man UTD Freak
item.description:
@Man_UTD_Freak wrote:

I really don’t have much of an understanding in this topic but if you have an S-Video input in both your TV screen and laptop, can’t you connect and display your laptop screen to the TV screen using an S-Video to S-Video cable? I’m not sure if it’s called an S-Video cable or S-Video input but that’s what I have heard of it as.

Read full topic
item.source: Help with making a tv screen a monitor

item.title: Help with making a tv screen a monitor
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

I bought a DVI to VGA cable, cost me something like £3, they’re dirt cheap if you know where to get them.

Read full topic
item.source: Help with making a tv screen a monitor

item.title: Help with making a tv screen a monitor
item.dc:creator: @fozzy fozzy
item.description:
@fozzy wrote:

sanga282:

my tv has VGA input

Yeah most newer models have VGA inputs, if you get lucky you don’t need to waste $20 on that cable.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with making a tv screen a monitor

item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Good point, I thought you were talking about old-style SD TVs.

item.source: Help with making a tv screen a monitor

item.title: Help with making a tv screen a monitor
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

most new tvs have vga input, if not, get a dvi to hdmi converter (assuming your pc has a dvi output)

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:2, topic:302172”]Does your video card have a TV out? Hook it up to your TV then. If it doesn’t you are pretty much out of luck.

Even if it does, a TV makes a horrible monitor, you will see what I mean if you get it hooked up.[/quote]
if its a 1080p tv, its not bad

Read full topic
item.source: Help with making a tv screen a monitor

item.title: Help with making a tv screen a monitor
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Does your video card have a TV out? Hook it up to your TV then. If it doesn’t you are pretty much out of luck.

Even if it does, a TV makes a horrible monitor, you will see what I mean if you get it hooked up.

Read full topic
item.source: Help with making a tv screen a monitor
